segments.text: I feel so bad for the woman because she’s about to have a very messy surprise.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She’s just standing there, drying dishes, while water spills everywhere.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is already wet, but she doesn’t even seem to notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I know that feeling of being so focused you miss everything else.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But this is next-level obliviousness, and it’s going to end badly.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are up to no good, and she’s going to be so disappointed when she finds out.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can already see the look on her face when she realizes what’s happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just going to keep pouring, and the floor is going to be ruined.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope she turns around soon before it’s too late.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This is the kind of moment that makes you sigh and shake your head.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish I could warn her, but it’s like watching a slow-motion disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR
